column5: 12footspringbok was the winner Norm, his name is Martin.
12footspringbok was the winner Norm, his name is Martin.

Martin looks so thrilled he can hardly contain himself. Congrats to you all for putting on and attending this event.  Like Beans said these bones aren't taking the cold like they used to.  Too bad some names aren't put with the faces. I recognize Joey and Chris from their avatars. Now I know what Misfish looks like. It's the layering of clothes that makes us look like Jenny Craig is needed, not the TimBits by the pail Misfish.

Fanatastic turnout by the looks of things... and what a tonne of awesome prizes for the event as well.  That's some derby motivation for others to come out and support in future events.  Well done by those who continue to make it all happen.

Awesome video there Moosebunk!  And now back to our regular programming.............if my buddy down in Angus keeps me up to speed on this for 2015, I hope to make it to that derby.  AND to bid on some of those awesome auction prizes!  (Old saying, I was a day late and a dollar short.........)  Doug
Okay, I added names, sorry should have done that from the beginning.  I have only forgotten 1 name (Mr. Buddy Heater winner).  Please refresh my memory for me anyone!!
. Terry AKA Hoppy.

Awesome video there Moosebunk!  And now back to our regular programming.............if my buddy down in Angus keeps me up to speed on this for 2015, I hope to make it to that derby.  AND to bid on some of those awesome auction prizes!  (Old saying, I was a day late and a dollar short.........)  Doug I'll keep you in the loop, this happens around the same time every year.
there goes my Anonymity  lol

:huh:Well, I do not know WHY I cannot make this reply add a quote...................  Anyways, back to Fisherman, yes please.  I am way overdue to hit Simcoe again, it has been years!  And heck I could pay your young lad to GUIDE for us!  Doug

:huh:Well, I do not know WHY I cannot make this reply add a quote...................  Anyways, back to Fisherman, yes please.  I am way overdue to hit Simcoe again, it has been years!  And heck I could pay your young lad to GUIDE for us!  Doug Quote button, bottom right should do it.
Was great to meet & fish with some OFC celebrities Breezy day out there. Had to use 8 anchors to hold the Clam down. Skunk is still holding strong for 2014
Great Pics everybody  Only wish I didn't have to work Saturday...The weather looked awesome for such an event

Back to Fisherman, yes the QUOTE button "SHOULD" work, but it doesn't for me, and I cannot copy and paste in a reply box either.  Maybe it is another thing I am not allowed to do because I am a newbie..............  Doug
Bye Bye cell phone Oh my - I'm sorry you lost your phone but this titled picture made me laugh
Woulda been hilarious if something shot up from the bottom

I am so peeeeeeed that I was not able to make it out to do what I said I was going to do....flip burgers and dogs... dame back just not what it should be.. still not moving to much Hope every one had a great time

Okay, I added names, sorry should have done that from the beginning.  I have only forgotten 1 name (Mr. Buddy Heater winner).  Please refresh my memory for me anyone!!  I would recognize that beautiful Gyotaku anywhere madam. Great work. Thanks for adding the names, nice to put a face to the stage names.  :huh:Well, I do not know WHY I cannot make this reply add a quote...................  Anyways, back to Fisherman, yes please.  I am way overdue to hit Simcoe again, it has been years!  And heck I could pay your young lad to GUIDE for us!  Doug  Doug if I remember correctly when I first joined certain features were disabled until I had a certain number of posts. Like PM'ing. It was only fall of 2013 but it seems like years ago sometimes. Surprised I can remember that far back. Love the avatar, Don King and Grisly Adams all in one.
WOW looks like a great turn out!  Good on everyone for participating

back to Old Ironmaker................  I suspected that might be the case, thanks.  Glad you like my avatar, that picture was taken in Cold Lake Alberta a couple years back when I fished and hunted my way from Kingston Ontario to the Yukon and back.  Now of the three names people have suggested, the only one I recognize is Grizzly Adams, and that is the one I get most often when I meet people.  Some folks talk about a show called Duck Dynasty where the fellows apparently have appropriate facial hair, maybe that is where one would find the Don King or the Phil somebody that Mike Borger mentioned?  I don't watch TV at all.....  But I have had a trim since that picture was taken....  And if I keep posting replies to interesting threads I guess my post count will eventually hit the threshold required for the ability to use more features here.  GOOD website, I am enjoying the TONE here, very civilized.  Doug

The only feature that is disabled until your 20th post is the ability to post to the classifieds forum. You've reached 20 posts now so you have access to classifieds.  I verified your profile and nothing is disabled. It has to do with your computer.

Back to Roy, thanks very much.  I can use a "quote" button on every other website I visit, so I will look again through the preferences and settings here to see if I can find a reason for this.  SORRY for the multiple hijacks...............  Doug

Doug,  Don King was the famous boxing promoter that had the vertical hair factor of 10. He was know for his poetry like diatribes that was usually utter nonsense to promote his prize fights and most importantly himself.  Hunted and fished across the country, that is interesting. That's a bundle in tags and fishing licenses.

back to Old Ironmaker, yes I had quite a few tags and licences that fall.  The biggest expense of course was diesel fuel for my F-250.  And I will stop this hi-jacking, and wrote a little intro, here:(drum roll)  OK, I can't do cut and paste the link here either, but if you go to the list of threads, there is one titled "Who is akaShag and why is he here?"  All is revealed..........  Doug

Was another great tournament.  Pauly came in third with a nice 26" laker (yes, Paul actually caught a fish in Lake Simcoe).  First prize was a 30" laker    and second was biggest perch, and there were some BIG perch!!!  I snapped a few pics, here they are in no particular order.   Fisherpete     Chuck and Tybo (Paul)      Misfish (Brian)        Pikeslayer (Simon), Misfish (Brian), Terry     Motiv8tor (Maureen)      Dynamic Bear and ChristopherK             12footspringbok (Martin)     Sorry, name escapes me right now, anyone feel free to help     - Far Right, Shelley (Ladywalleye)    Tybo (Paul)         Tyler (with the Ipad) and sorry, not sure of your name with that beautiful Gyotaku     Terry, dreaming of french fries
Looks like a gorgeous day!  Wish I could have been there...
WOOOOOOOOOOOHOOOOOOOOOOOO! Looks like a great time Hun. Is that auger for you or for Paul?  Thanks for the pics.....I was looking forward to seeing some.
Well Roy, usually Paul Augs and I catch, but now I'm not sure what will happen
thanks for posting them  nice going Paul

Sure was a blustery day. Had to use all five anchors to hold the hub down,or it would of been,Huston,we have lift off,then like my fellow angler today,Huston,we have a problem.LOL  Great day none the less. Getting to see friends that we dont get to see alot,yet chat on the board.  Fished today with Terry,Simon and his SNL and Fisherpete.  I have to say no fish for use was due to me. I thought for sure they would be there. Man,not even a herring. Wat up wit dat?  Still good to be out and sharing the sport we love.  The attachments went fast.   Some pics from today.
wow great pictures Joey and Misfish
Looks like a great time, for a great cause. Wish I could have been there....  Thanks for pics guys  G
OH MY,BACK TO THE GYM.LOL
The camera adds 10 lbs B.  You look maaaaaavelous
you mean back to the ribs and pulled pork and   lol lol
I am ABSOLUTELY THRILLED to see so many fellows with facial hair!  YES I just started out here, but you are my kind of people!  Doug

I am ABSOLUTELY THRILLED to see so many fellows with facial hair!  YES I just started out here, but you are my kind of people!  Doug OMG Doug, which cave have you been hiding in.  You know who that is in picture # 11 holding the trolling motor..
EINRICH!!!!!Is that Gopher?  Doug
I am ABSOLUTELY THRILLED to see so many fellows with facial hair!  YES I just started out here, but you are my kind of people!  Doug   Is that really you in your avatar?
YES SIR that is indeed me.  Doug
PS)  I had a trim since that picture was taken.............
EINRICH!!!!!  Is that Gopher?  Doug Yup.
COOL>  Please tell him he looks great in a beard................
YES SIR that is indeed me.  Doug  Phil Robertson's got nothing on you!!

Terrible start to what ended up being a good day. Had to pull the auger over a million times to make it go first thing. Worked up a serious sweat, and was just about to give up and ask the closest group to punch me a couple holes when it finally went... Took a little tumble going over a pressure crack first thing running up the lake...:wallbash:Almost forgot about it until waking up from an afternoon nap, ouch.It was nice to meet a couple new members and see some familiar faces as well.  Had a few fish come unbuttoned when I did find some around 9:30 and finally got a couple through the hole by ten o'cklock or so. Oh ya then I dropped the cell down the hole...Might I say Tyler looked and sounded the best I've seen him. Good stuff. Couple pics from my morning. Derby WinnerBye Bye cell phone

Wow, that was a bad morning, but look how you made out  It was nice seeing you and congrats on the winner.  We figured Paul was gonna take it for awhile there, then you brought that beast in  I'm sure it was time for a new cell phone anyhow right
Looks like another great event congrats thanks for taking the time to post pictures.

Nice pics everyone !...Just finished saving them all in my Tyler G2Gs folder...  And kudos to all that participated...unfortunately my old bones don't take to the cold anymore...  Do the winners have names ?...Except for Paul and Terry, I don't recognize the others...
